page.title: 11Bawcombe Cottage Bradstone
page.content: Approached by private road, the cottage commands a magnificent view over the Tamar valley and rolling countryside to Bodmin Moor. The fifty year old cottage has electrictiy and telephone but private water and drainage. Owner occupiers are a retired farmer who came from North Cornwall and farmed at Bowcombe for 40 years, his Plymouth born wife who teaches at Lifton CP school and his mother. Happy and active they neither envisage nor desire change, but emphasise concern at unemployment, loss of traditional values & lack of education for leisure. The surrounding farmland belonging to Bawcombe Farm supports milk herd and sheep. Mainly grassland, some arable and deciduous woodland. Origin of partly demolished obelisk unknown.Could have been marker stone of Hayne/Lifton Park estate.
